subSubSection.paragraph:
TYPE
DEPOSITORY: of
L . dentatus
: Department of Medical Zoology, School of Tropical Medicine, San Juan, Puerto Rico ; of
L . scapulatus
: United States National Museum, Washington DC, USA ; of
L . analis
: British Museum (Natural History), London, England .

TYPE
LOCALITY AND HABITAT : of
L . dentatus : Camp O’Reilly
, Gurabo, Puerto Rico , on
Rattus
species or
Mus m
.
musculus
( sic ) [Animalia: Muridae ]; of
L . scapulatus : Morgan Hill
, California, USA , on eggs of
Paria
sp. [Animalia: Chrysomelidae ] on strawberry [Plantae: Rosaceae ]; of
L . analis : Bucasa Range
, near Kampala, Uganda , in nest of social spiders [Animalia: Araneae ].

NOTES : (a)
Evans ( 1958 a: 224 )
,
Athias-Henriot ( 1959 : 189 )
and
Farrier & Hennessey ( 1993 : 36 )
considered
Lasioseius floridensis Berlese
to be a senior synonym of L . (=
Borinquolaelaps
)
dentatus Fox. We
adopted the interpretation of
Britto et al . ( 2011
: 13 ), considering them to be distinct species; (b)
Evans ( 1958 b: 582 )
considered the possibility that
L . dentatus
could be a junior synonym of
Lasioseius ( Lasioseius ) muricatus var. transoceanicus
, a nomen nudum according to
Evans ( 1958 a: 224 )
; (c)
Farrier & Hennessey ( 1993 : 36 )
considered
L . floridensis
to be a senior synonym of
L . scapulatus
, but
Britto et al . ( 2011
: 14 ) considered them to be distinct species; that latter interpretation is accepted in this publication; (d) Specimens reported as
L . scapulatus
by
Athias-Henriot ( 1959 : 175 )
were described by
Karg ( 1980 : 356 )
as
Lasioseius scapulatosimilis
.
